userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Norfolk Western and Norfolk Southern Railway Company Records must be obtained from the Special Collections, Virginia Tech. Information from personnel records of any kind must be published only in a statistical or disguised manner (not revealing individual identities) in order to protect the privacy of individuals who are not historical figures. Researchers will be required to sign a form stating they understand and accept these restrictions before being allowed access to the collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Norfolk and Western Railway Archive and the Southern Railroad Archive are two large collections reflecting the development of railroad transportation from the 19th to the 21st century. The Norfolk and Western Railway began operation in Petersburg, Virginia with a nine-mile line in 1838, and it eventually merged with over 200 railroad companies to encompass more than 7,000 miles of road. The Southern Railroad Company was organized in 1894 from the bankrupt Richmond and Danville Railroad and several other railroad companies. The Southern Railroad eventually became the product of nearly 150 predecessor lines that were combined, reorganized, and recombined since the 1830s. In 1982 the Norfolk and Western Railway combined with the Southern Railroad creating the Norfolk Southern Railway. In total, the collection is comprised of over 350 smaller railroad companies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The Norfolk and Western (later to become the Norfolk Southern Railway) collection documents the development of railroad transportation from the 19th to the 21st century. The Norfolk and Western Railway merged with the Southern Railroad to become the Norfolk Southern Railway. The collection primarily documents the over 200 railroad companies that merged over almost a century to become the Norfolk Western. These records are organized in two series: Railway Records and Public Relations Photograph Series. The Railway Records, forming the bulk of the collection, are comprised of individual company records such as stockholders' and directors' minutes, stock certificates, finance dockets, reports and statistics, etc. Also included are pre-Civil War accounting records of the predecessor companies, Presidential papers of Samuel Spencer and several Southern Railroad vice- presidents, Law Department letter books, ledgers, and railroad publications. In addition, the record files include individual personnel records from the Norfolk and Western and a large collection of maps consisting of railroad route maps and bridge drawings from various railroad companies.

The Public Relations Photograph Series contains approximately 30,000 photographs from the Public Relations Department of the Norfolk and Western Railway. Included in the photographs are images of locomotives, coal mines, group and individual employee portraits, train wrecks, cities and towns, images from Hotel Roanoke, etc. Many of the railroad images housed at Virginia Tech are also online at the VT Imagebase.
